title.narrative: Installation of a milk collection/processing unit in Aleppo Governorate, Syrian Arab Republic

description.narrative: 1. The Syria smallholder support programme (SSP) for agriculture transformation is supported by the European Union (EU) and implemented by FAO, piloting a local-level intervention which aim is to empower smallholder farmers’ role in the agriculture sector, by giving them the means to be more competitive and more sustainable, as the sector emerges from the ongoing crisis. The project will run for 3 years, thereby offering a medium-term timeframe to catalyze a transition in the Syrian agriculture sector. 2. SSP aims at two specific objectives: Objective 1. Support smallholder farmers and livestock keepers to be more productive, more efficient and more profitable Objective 2. Support smallholder farmers and livestock keepers, and their communities as a whole, to be more informed, more self-organised and more risk-aware 3. FAO has requested UNIDO’s support to deliver on objective 1., to increase smallholder access to market opportunities and revenues by means of enhanced value chain analysis, specifically for the dairy sector. The aim is to install a milk collection/production unit. 4. UNIDO’s intervention will be delivered in 2 phases: Phase 1 (3 months): Detailed implementation plan of the intervention (infrastructure, equipment, time and human resources), including technical specifications of the necessary equipment in order to install a milk collection/processing unit in Aleppo governorate, Syria Phase 2 (18 months): setting up one milk processing unit in Aleppo, and training of small-scale dairy producers, processors, and/or traders on good milk production practices
